body: @neilcsmith-net It means that we can't merge not related NB11.1 changes into the master, doesn't it? Did you announce that thing? Probably, current PRs are set `into master`. Instead, I think you should show what we should do. Otherwise, maybe all approved PRs would be merged into the master branch.

@junichi11 yes, and yes, although I should have done another announcement earlier today, so apologies for that.  Nothing should be merged unless it's tagged NB11.1 until the merge window reopens.  If there's a need to merge somewhere for collaboration or other purposes, then we might need to consider short-lived branches.  There's a thread on dev@ now - probably better to discuss your specific needs and thoughts about this PR there?  Thanks, Neil

@neilcsmith-net Very surprising and unusual, at least for me. Will be IMHO quite difficult to follow it for all the members (commiters). But I can be wrong, we will see.

@junichi11 We can easily revert it, right?

@tmysik it was discussed on dev@ so I'm concerned it was surprising.  It doesn't feel unusual to me as I've seen it on other projects.  Adopting it wasn't my idea originally - I just resurrected one of the more sensible suggestions for reducing our release overhead in switching to quarterly releases - keeping master releaseable and cherry-picking to a minimum.   However, the idea is to at least review post-NB 11.1, or during if it becomes a problem, so if you have specific concerns please jump on dev@ and air them!
I did not squash the commits into a single one, should I close this PR and create another? After all this PR would be merged to NB 11.2 and it will have a cleaner history.

@tmysik Yes, we should be able to do it with the revert button.
@neilcsmith-net Do you revert it? If yes, please feel free to do it. or Should I do it?

> I did not squash the commits into a single one, should I close this PR and create another?

Please don't worry. We can squashing the PR via the "Squash and merge" button. Of course, you can squash them yourself, then you can also force-push.  So need not to close this PR :)

Thanks for fixing it. We cannot merge this into the master branch in the current phase(we can merge only PRs related to NB11.1, currently). So please wait a while. Thanks!
IMO, this is a good candidate for merging for NB 11.1. Has a JIRA ticket, and fixes a bug.  https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-2660
@neilcsmith-net No, there is the button. please try searching this page or please have a look at the above of your first comment.
@junichi11 Sorry, completely missed that!  Opened a revert PR.
Theoretically we're past feature freeze for NB 11.1.  I'll let @jlahoda comment on whether we should allow through or retarget for NB 11.2.

Hi @vieiro, and @neilcsmith-net (sorry I wouldn't distract you from  release process 11.1). This incomplete PR try to remove the apidoc reconfiguration of branding on branch cut but it may be extended for general branding.
I would know if it make sense and if there may be some missing branding we can put into json file https://github.com/apache/netbeans-jenkins-lib/blob/master/meta/netbeansrelease.json

Neil, would you be so kind and approve merging of this change into 11.1? It is not a bugfix in Apache NetBeans per se, but it is a bugfix for [IGV](https://www.graalvm.org/docs/graalvm-as-a-platform/implement-language/#igv) to remove a nasty reflection that workaround the missing API.

I am convinced the change is compatible and should have no negative impact on stability of 11.1.
@neilcsmith-net Please feel free to merge it.
@junichi11 done, thanks!
Fine with me, on your head be it.  I assume you didn't mean "I am not convinced"?! :smile:
@neilcsmith-net You are the release manager. So I think you can merge this PR if it's OK with you.
Please add me as a reviewer on anything going into NB 11.1, just so I can track things as required.  Thanks!
@junichi11 just giving anyone a chance to disagree! Right, squashing and merging.
Thanks for the add.  Fine with me if you want to merge when ready.

Hi @ebarboni , I'm afraid I don't currently have time to go through this complex setup. I can't tell if "remove of properties in nbbuild/build.properties:" has implications in other parts of the NetBeans build infrastructure. Will this break project builds?

Currently the javadoc publishing is being done by adding entries by hand in a script file in netbeans-vm.apache.org. AFAICT the information in the JSON file seems enough to try to make this more automatic, but I can't currently tackle this. You can find the script file at @netbeans-vm.apache.org/usr/share/netbeans-javadoc.
What is an mx project?

It would be nice to have this one in nb11.1, because it is a good supporting feature for the various preview features we have in 11.1 (and also in 11.0), i.e., it simplifies their enablement. But if this makes it in in 11.2, that's also fine, no prob at all.
Thanks, this looks interesting, can you provide some screenshots of what the UI for this looks like, i.e., what the user will see?
@jlahoda  I had addressed all the review comment. Request you to review

The `mx` project is a project type used to develop GraalVM and also used by Ideal Graph Visualiser which is built on top of NetBeans platform.
But this API is generic not just for `mx`. Any project type now can use per-project platform , which was impossible before.

@lkishalmi thanks!  Was on my list to ask you about this.  What exactly triggers the Snap build?  Should this be merged now or when we're ready for a release voting candidate?  Now or longer term (particuarly if an aspiration is for releases off master as some suggested) can we do this in such a way that both Snap descriptors can co-exist?

@vieiro, for now it did not hurt the other build target because it regenerate the previous properties from the json.
I also mainly try to do list of version somehow automatic also to avoid editing xsl on release. 

I will try to setup a webserver to get it live.

By the way I'm not sure that only javadoc date and javadoc category are the element to configure per release.

u need to  add --enable-preview  in compiler VM args
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32263739/59848052-d7acc880-9381-11e9-98a7-16ec1c1f5ce8.png)

hi @neilcsmith-net and thanks ? it perfectly fit what I was asking. (I ad a limited javadoc centric view)
Some more work to do on the bundle.

I guess I will do as fast as I could maybe 11.3 (if too complex) but it's ok to do like we were doing for the first apidoc rewrite to be (incubating compliant) and commit change to all branch event after release. And hopefully we can branch future release without thinking on this anymore.

@neilcsmith-net https://builds.apache.org/job/netbeans-snap-release/ is triggered manually.
This PR shall be merged before and built by the standard Linux release job before the first triggering it.
I've created NETBEANS-2729 for myself on the co-exists issue. That shouldn't be that hard.

The snap release is pushing to the edge track of the netbeans snap. It has to be manually promoted to the stable track when the time comes. Though users can opt-in using a edge/beta version if you wish to publish it this way.
@matthiasblaesing - if you get chance, I would appreciate your critical appraisal, particularly around license files in AWS SDK module...
Updated -license.txt headers as per https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/NETBEANS/Legal+FAQ.  Hopefully, this will resolve the Travis build failure...
@lkishalmi great!  Feel free to merge this when you've finished pushing to it. :smile:
I discovered the problem while working on https://github.com/oracle/visualvm/pull/137/ CCing @thurka

@tmysik I prefer to create PRs per feature. However, I'm going to add my changes for PHP 7.4 support to this PR(netbeans-1696-php7.4-support branch) because we can't merge changes into the master branch now and the next changes often depend on the previous changes. 

New commit is this: https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/1314/commits/e4f1e0eb4c5cf0edbfc3c83f6d7d13c14f5cf8fb

Updated -license.txt files (again!) so that they *exactly* match the content of the `nbbuild/licenses` folder.  Added binary dependencies that are the same as Gradle module to `ignored-overlaps`, as two module are probably never likely to be updated at the same time....

3rd time lucky?

> I prefer to create PRs per feature

You can set up a php7.4 branch in the main repo and set that as the base branch for the PRs, including this one, if that works better for you?  We can then merge from there after NB 11.1.  The release process is not meant to get in the way of using PRs on a per-feature basis.

> You can set up a php7.4 branch in the main repo and set that as the base branch for the PRs

OK, will do. Thanks.
Created the `php7.4` branch, then changed the base branch to it. From now on, I'll create PRs for PHP 7.4 support to the `php7.4` branch.
@neilcsmith-net Will delete the branch.

@Chris2011, yes, there is an API. A short description is in the apichanges:
https://bits.netbeans.org/dev/javadoc/org-netbeans-modules-editor-lib2/apichanges.html#PrependedTextOpt

Basically, create a highlight that will have "virtual-text-prepend" as the highlight key, value is the virtual text. This is the place where it is used in Java, which may be useful as well:
https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/0c67f21385ea5ddc0cf29be5d959ae2897c47f49/java/java.editor/src/org/netbeans/modules/java/editor/semantic/SemanticHighlighter.java#L75

@junichi11 

Maybe try to add test for e.g. `11_22` (`Use cases to avoid` in [docs](https://wiki.php.net/rfc/numeric_literal_separator))? If I understand it correctly, it is valid (it should be avoided but still, it is not a syntax error). Am I right? Thanks.
Great. Thx :)

@junichi11 

> It means that `__serialize()` and `__unserialize()` are always available although they are available since PHP 7.4. i.e. The two methods are added without checking the PhpVersion.

Totally OK, in the code base, we always support the latest PHP runtime (and provide detailed info in PhpDoc and/or error hints).

> It means this, right?

Yes, exactly.
(In fact, I would expect that only "grouping numbers by 3" will be possible but apparently it is not.)

Thanks!
@tmysik Fixed. Thanks!
@junichi11 Great, thank you!
I am always glad to see more tests! This change looks amazing. Moreover the new job with tests runs just 13 min!
You appear to have used NETBEANS-2475, which is an unrelated bug report in JIRA.
Thanks @ApolloLV , I had corrected the commit message now
I'll have a look at it, will most probably take till next week though.

I see the CI fail, but unclear to me why this small change would break anything.  Maybe somebody more familiar with the project can take a look.

The CI fail is something about:

The command "ant $OPTS clean" exited with 1.
@matthiasblaesing No rush!  Appreciate your time and patience.

@geertjanw thanks, saves me a job on my list for today. There was a commit for NB11.0 for this but unfortunately had extra things we don't need.

Travis seems to be failing all over the shop at the moment!  May just merge these two as they don't touch anything that can break anything?!
Given changes already in release111 can this be merged post-release?  If so, should tag with NB11.2
Agree, merge these two, when/if you’re ready for them.

@jkovalsky can we keep this to just re-adding the Third-Party Libraries back in?  As mentioned off-list, I'm not sure we should add the version number in the descriptions, particularly not with 11.0 in it, and the plugin link should be functionally correct already.  Happy to reconsider between beta2 and beta3 next week, but I need to sort this build now or it won't happen this week.
@jperedadnr is working on this.
Awesome!
Wow, great you worked on this. But why did this work in 8.2 without this fix? We should definitely include this in 11.1.

There was this optimalization done after 8.2:
http://hg.netbeans.org/main/rev/2d82f8c0a290

But, sadly, it goes too far, and disables locals computation even in cases where it shouldn't, IMO, be disabled.

There is also this semi-related issue with the "red coffee cups" obscuring red error indicators: 
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-2608

Demonstrated here on the left (with old ones from other PR on right), with NB default and Darcula light/dark themes: https://imgur.com/yZYqTY7

I have to say I'm disappointed we aren't getting the blue versions, IMO they looked much better alongside NB's other color schemes. IntelliJ has a different design where they don't show the icon in their main workspace (it's only one "project" at a time anyway), and IIRC Eclipse doesn't use icons at all in their main workspace. NetBeans design is different in that it uses colored icons for _each_ project. 

The grey isn't as bad on the dark background, but on the default NetBeans white background the grey icons are almost invisible to me. Grey kinda makes me think "disabled/inactive" in this context. 

(Also I think NetBeans already uses greyed-out icons to indicate "de-activated module" project types when creating a new project, but that's a minor issue.)

Yes, the Payara PR update will need merging to fix Travis tests. It was not the cause of the original Travis failures (which might be infrastructure related) - everything was going red before I merged the Payara stuff for beta 2. Do merge the fix if you want (I'm not in position to for another day or two)

Apologies for the removal of trailing spaces which occurs during the removal of the license header modification.
If needed I'll cancel this PR and create a new one. Just let me know.
Merged, let's see if this fixes Travis as well...
Merging #1334 put the master back on track. I'm closing this one.

@geertjanw 
inspect output:
![obraz](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8476571/60459252-f132f780-9c40-11e9-8e0c-cfad16127ada.png)

process list output:
![obraz](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8476571/60459309-16c00100-9c41-11e9-8d95-f2c3025d9d05.png)

These changes break the unittests:
- TinyTest#testAssertEqualsForArrays
- TinyTest#testAssertEqualsForArraysWithMessages

The issue is, that you are changing test code that is supplied as a string. For these it is not enough, that they still compile.
Please rebase on current master. @neilcsmith-net @geertjanw shall this be marked for 11.1?
We need this in beta-3 so we can make sure it works for 11.1.
Great to have this PR in any way that works best for you and also works in every other sense.
Since Matthias has found a problem, I'll close this and pick it up at a later date..
Since 11.1 is the first release of NetBeans outside the Apache incubator, would be cool if the old blue NetBeans icon were to be replaced in the toolbar with the new Apache NetBeans icon.
Since 11.1 is the first release of NetBeans outside the Apache incubator, would be cool if the old blue NetBeans icon were to be replaced in the toolbar with the new Apache NetBeans icon.
@neilcsmith-net Well, not a major improvement, but pretty trivial one. Could be considered for 11.1.
@jlahoda merging this for NB11.1-beta3. I believe all changes requested have been made? Please raise concerns if required before the voting candidate is built so can be addressed or reverted. Thanks.
@jlahoda @geertjanw Should we aim to get this in NB11.1?

@lkishalmi has anyone tested this on macOS?  AFAIK macOS still doesn't have a real implementation of NIO2 watchers.  I ship my own stuff without the native handlers and not noticed a problem, but there tend to be a lot less files in play at any one time there.

@junichi11 https://netbeans.apache.org/participate/submit-pr.html is saying that we should not touch the PR's after the submission. Should I squash nevertheless or should I cancel it and create a new one (with a single commit) ?

@YannLeCorse I think we should review that text, as it's in direct opposition to point 10 for a start! :smile: Changes to meet reviews and other requirements should go in the same PR.  I think that point is intended to stop people changing what has already been reviewed or +1'd?

Unless someone has a burning requirement for me to merge for NB11.1 beta today, this will be held back to merge for NB11.2 when that window opens in a couple of weeks anyway.
OK, re-triggered tests pass so merging.

@YannLeCorse 
> Should I squash nevertheless or should I cancel it and create a new one (with a single commit) ?

No, don't worry :) You can leave this as it is.

That label(Need squashing) is for a person who merges this. 
If a PR has some commits and each commit is meaningful and the review was done, the author should squash properly before it is merged, I suppose. In this PR, we need just one commit, so mergers can squash and merge via the Squash and merge button :)

Well, indeed MacOS still uses the Poller implementation: https://hg.openjdk.java.net/jdk/jdk/file/19d0b382f086/src/java.base/macosx/classes/sun/nio/fs/BsdFileSystem.java
Thanks for pointing this out. I'm going to realign the positions according to that.
Is this a candidate for 11.1?

@ebresie at this stage, I would say probably not, although someone else might have a different opinion?  Somehow we've missed flagging this for merging prior to freeze or inclusion in a beta release.  And sorry, I also missed the link to a critical issue in JIRA for this, although it's only marked as a partial fix.

At this stage, I think we need to hold for NB11.2, and merge along with @lkishalmi NIO2 change and prioritise some of those performance issues with files early in the next release cycle?
Connecting this to j2ee.kit makes sense, especially if it works.

Considered re-rolling against master but until we fix the plugin center changes in master post-release it doesn't work there to test anyway.  Once we decide what we do in master for dev plugin centers we should consider adding this change there.  So, keeping to release branch only for now.
See #1356 - hopefully good to go for release, so closing this.  Note that a similar change will be required in master once we've opened the merge window for NB 11.2.

Though it is a minor and might be cosmetic only.
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-2792
Yes, it became a huge patch since I added many unit tests (There are about 220 files related to tests)... Thank you!
Awesome. :-)
Great!  Is this ready to merge for NB11.1?  If so, or when it is, please tag me as a reviewer and label with NB11.1 so I know it's ready.  Thanks!
